intro: Pinalia maingayi, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-orange inflorescences that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are sturdy and branched. Pinalia maingayi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
